location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter No. 1546: William Henry Wathen, Chief Secretary to Government, Bombay, to the Acting Resident in the Persian Gulf

mods.abstract: In this letter, William Henry Wathen, Chief Secretary to Government, Bombay, acknowledges receipt of a letter from the Acting Resident in the Persian Gulf, dated 4 August 1837, which contained a translation of a letter from the Imaum of Muscat who complains of aggressions committed by the subjects of Sheik Sultan bin Sugger [Sulṭān bin Saqr Āl Qāsimī] upon the inhabitants of Zanzibar. Wathen informs the Acting Resident that the course of proceedings meets the approval of the Governor in Council.
